ai.summary: A demanding 25.3 km circuit on the Monument Trail at Ickworth Estate in the UK. This hard hike features varied terrain, steady elevation, and rewarding views across estate grounds and surrounding countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surfaces including grassy estate tracks, compact gravel paths, and occasional muddy woodland sections. Expect uneven footing, moderate to steep ascents, and potential boggy patches after rain. Several sections offer exposed ground and long sightlines.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day with ample water and snacks. Wear sturdy boots, use layered clothing, and bring a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of livestock and cyclists on shared routes, and carry a map or GPS. Check weather conditions, bring a headlamp as a precaution, and inform someone of your route. Respect private property and estate rules.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
2–3 liters of water and high-energy snacks
Layered clothing with a waterproof jacket and pants
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Emergency whistle and a thermal/space blanket
Walking poles (optional but helpful for long grades)
Light rain cover for the backpack

seo.title: Monument Trail, Ickworth Estate – 25.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Monument Trail at Ickworth Estate, a challenging 25.3 km hike in the UK. Get terrain details, safety tips, and essential gear for a successful day on the trail.
